Posts.Title: FORCE chat-a-thon for BRCA women and high-risk women
Free webcast for 2-day FORCE conference on hereditary breast and ovarian cancer and BRCA

Posts.Content:
Thank you so much MK,
It feels to great to be welcomed back, even if it's just to say "hello" and tell you what I'm up to. You guys have been there for me through the years. I really appreciate it.
Warmest regards,
Sue
Posts.Title: Joining FORCEs newsletter for women affected by hereditary breast and ovarian cancer!

Posts.Content:
Dear Friends,
I know that I don't post here much anymore (really really busy with FORCE) but I wanted to announce an exciting (to me) update.Â  FORCE: Facing Our Risk of Cancer Empowered, a national nonprofit organization dedicated to hereditary breast and ovarian cancer has developed a newsletter devoted to hereditary breast and ovarian cancer. The newsletter will be available in May. If you'd like to be added to the mailing list, we are using a secure server system to collect information through a site called surveymonkey. FORCE does not share information wtih any 3rd parties. Here is the link to sign up for the newsletter:
The first issue has articles on MRI for high risk women, proteomics for ovarian cancer detection and stories from high-risk women.
Warm regards,
Sue
